Package address.data

Class AddressBook

java.lang.Object
address.data.AddressBook
public class AddressBook extends Object
Since:
1.2 The purpose of this class is to represent a generic address book

  • Field Details

    • addressEntryList

      private final TreeMap<String,TreeSet<AddressEntry>> addressEntryList
      the data structures that will hold the data for the address book. Composed of a TreeMap where the key is a String(the last name of the AddressEntry) and the value is a TreeSet of the AddressEntry. This is because java does not contain a multiset in standard libraries. Tree is used instead of hash because tree preserves the natural ordering of key which makes printing in sorted order by last name(key) easy.

    • SQL_DELETE

      private static final String SQL_DELETE
      format for PreparedStatement for DELETE

  • Method Details

    • list

      public String list()
      a method which prints out all fields in all entries of the address book
      Returns:
      prints out entry in a formatted string

    • delete

      public void delete(String firstName, String lastName, String street, String city, String state, Integer zip, String email, String phone, Integer id) throws SQLException
      a method which deletes an entry in the database matching the given parameters
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name
      lastName - is the last name
      street - is the street
      city - is the city
      state - is the state
      zip - is the zip
      email - is the email
      phone - is the phone
      id - is the id
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQL error

    • remove

      public void remove(String lastName) throws SQLException
      a method which removes an address entry from the address book
      Parameters:
      lastName - is the last name(or some initial consecutive chars) of the person contained in the AddressEntry to be removed
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is a database error First we get the prefixSet which is the set of all AddressEntry that have the first consecutive of the lastName of AddressEntry match the lastName parameter passed. If the size of the set is 1 then print out AddressEntry and prompt user if they wish to delete. If more than 1 element in set then print all elements and ask user to select element based on index.

    • create

      public void create(String firstName, String lastName, String street, String city, String state, Integer zip, String email, String phone, Integer id) throws SQLException
      a method which creates an entry in the database with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name
      lastName - is the last name
      street - is the street
      city - is the city
      state - is the state
      zip - is the zip
      email - is the email
      phone - is the phone
      id - is the id
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQL error

    • add

      public void add(AddressEntry entry) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      a method which adds an address entry to the address book and database
      Parameters:
      entry - the instance of AddressEntry beijng added to the AddressBook and database
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is a database error
      ClassNotFoundException - when correct Oracle driver is not available If the key has never been seen before then a new TreeSet is created to contain the entry. If the key has been seen before then entry is simply added to the correct set.

    • addLocally

      public void addLocally(AddressEntry entry)
      a method which adds an address entry to the address book only
      Parameters:
      entry - the instance of AddressEntry being added to the AddressBook

    • readFromFile

      public void readFromFile(String filename)
      a method which reads in address entries from a text file and adds them to the address book
      Parameters:
      filename - is a string which is the name of a text file that contains address Entry data in a certain format the format is firstName\nlastName\nAdress\ncity\nState\nzip\nemail\nphoneNumber

    • find

      public void find(String startOf_lastName)
      a method which displays one or multiple address entries
      Parameters:
      startOf_lastName - is a string which contains either a full last name or the first consecutive chars of a last name in an AddressEntry

    • getPrefixSet

      private TreeSet<AddressEntry> getPrefixSet(String startOf_lastName)
      a method that returns a set of address entries in which the first characters in the last name of each entry in the returned set are an exact match for the characters passed to the function
      Parameters:
      startOf_lastName - full last name or start of last name
      Returns:
      A TreeSet which contains all of the AddressEntry instances whose lastName field matches from the start every char provided in startOf_lastName.

    • clear

      public void clear() throws SQLException
      removes all AddressEntry from the AddressBook and database
      Throws:
      SQLException - when there is a database error
